home.menu.options.game.rules.discard_mov: When Battle starts, the game will discard any <style="value">Movement</style>, <style="value">Teleport</style> and <style="value">Leadership</style> points leftover from <style="status">Exploration</style>. [default = <style="value">NO</style>]

Will not show the Activation Menu for Card, Followers or Blessings activation if they don't require payment or Player selection. For example, A card with Move 2 / Move 4 will automatically create the Move 2 effect on top action click, but not Move 4 since the bottom action requires Mana payment which will trigger the Activation menu as usual.

Will not show the <style="value">Mana Selection Menu</style> for Card, Followers or Blessings activation if they only require a single <style="value">Basic</style> Mana and there is only one Mana available to pay with. Or if the cost is paid by discarding or throwing Wounds.
If enabled and you have Wounds in Hand, and no wounded Followers, playing Healing effects will automatically apply the Healing points towards healing your wounds.

home.menu.options.game.accessibility.dra: Replace holding the mouse to Drag by clicking to select the item, moving the item then clicking to release it.

Replace all colored tags from Card / Followers / Blessings by a single color to improve readability.

Change the max font size for cards to improve readability. If the text doesn't fit in the box it will be sized down otherwise it will occupy the whole box up to the max font size specified.

home.menu.restart_turn.confirm.title: Restart the Turn?
home.menu.restart_turn.confirm.descripti: Going back to the <style="value">Beginning of the Turn</style> will erase all progress since the turn started like explored Map areas, recruited Followers, healed wounds, etc.
Heya, seems like it's your first time playing Paladin's Oath. The game can be quite intimidating and obtuse if you are not familiar with complex card games like Mage Knight or Gloomhaven. I created a tutorial as a set of mini puzzles to learn the mechanics in a fun way (no big yellow arrows and click here click there instructions). Would you like to try it out? You can always figure things out by yourself first and later do the tutorials for the mechanics you don't fully understand (the battle system is notably the most complex part of the game for example). Thanks for buying my game and hope you have fun!
loading.tips.0: Don't be afraid to take a few <style="wound">Wounds</style> if a battle allows you to <style="status">level-up</style>.
loading.tips.1: Always check the <style="status">Fortification</style> of enemies before engaging in Battle. This will limit your <style="value">Range</style> options.
loading.tips.2: Remember enemies with <style="value">Elemental Resistance</style> are <style="status">Immune</style> to non-attack/block effects from cards of the same color.
loading.tips.3: Follow what your <style="value">Hand</style> says: If you have a lot of Movement cards, don't try to battle, just Move and Explore.
loading.tips.4: Your Followers can help you <style="status">Tank</style> damage from Attacks.
loading.tips.5: Avoid acquiring too many <style="value">Cards of the same color</style>  as they will be competing for the same Mana.
loading.tips.6: Don't hesitate to spend a few turns at a Location to <style="value">Recruit</style> more Followers or <style="value">Buy</style> more Cards.
loading.tips.7: Artifacts are really powerful. Don't hesitate to burn that Temple if you are done with it.
loading.tips.8: Managing Movement and Battle with the same set of cards is hard. Don't hesitate to <style="value">change the Oath</style> if you are struggling with Movement.
loading.tips.9: Don't forget to try the various Scenarios, they all require different approaches and playstyles.
